name: xlr8
summary: On a show like Ben 10, good old-fashioned coolness matters a lot, and the coolest of the Omnitrix aliens was XLR8. As his name implies, XLR8, a member of the Kineceleran species, possessed super speed. This meant XLR8 was not only plenty useful in a fight, but in many ways, the Omnitrix alien most useful for practical, everyday purposes.

name: Upgrade
summary: Diamondhead isn't the only inorganic alien in the Omnitrix. Upgrade, a Galvanic Mechamorph, was composed of nano-machines that, together, formed a vaguely humanoid blob with a cyclopean head. This meant Upgrade's design struck a balance of humanoid and alien, with the green-and-black grid lines along his body a hint at his technological origins.

name: Diamondhead
summary: Diamondhead is a Petrosapien, a species of silicon-based life-forms. As a result, his body is composed of crystals as hard as diamonds. Of the Omnitrix aliens, his super-strength and durability ranked second only to Four Arms.

name: Heatblast
summary: In the series premiere 'And Then There Were 10,' the first alien Ben transformed into after he found the Omnitrix was Heatblast. The Omnitrix's sample of the Pyronite species, Heatblast, was essentially a being of living magma. He also more than lived up to Ben's name for him, being able to generate and shoot fire from all across his body.

name: Stinkfly
summary: Stinkfly, a Lepidopterran, ties with Wildmutt for the prize of least humanoid Omnitrix alien. However, Stinkfly also had some advantages that put him ahead. For one, he was capable of human speech, even if Ben's voice did come out distorted.
info: Stinkfly Made Up For Weakness With Speed And Flight.

name: Four Arms
summary: Just as Ben disdained Grey Matter, he loved Four Arms â€” the least creatively named and most humanoid of the original aliens. A member of the Tetramand species, Four Arms stood 12 feet tall, had super strength and greater dexterity than any human, thanks to his huge size and extra set of arms.
info: Four Arms Was Useful But Generic.

name: Grey Matter
summary: Being a 10 year old boy, Ben was anything but a model of maturity and strategic thinking. That meant his least favorite of the Omnitrix aliens was Grey Matter. This form was the Omnitrix sample of a Galvan, a 6-inch tall, physically feeble species, albeit one with super-intelligence. Indeed, it later turned out that a Galvan named Azmuth was the Omnitrix's creator.
info: Grey Matter Was Smart But Weak.

name: Ghostfreak
summary: Ghostfreak was the strangest of the Omnitrix aliens and plenty useful. His powers include invisibility, intangibility, and the ability to possess other living beings. However, in Season 2 episode 'Ghostfreaked Out,' it turned out Ghostfreak had the biggest drawback of any of Ben's aliens.
info: Ghostfreak Was Powerful, But Had The Biggest Drawback Of All.

name: Wildmutt
summary: The most animalistic of Ben's transformations was Wildmutt. The alien was the Omnitrix sample of a Vulpimancer, an eyeless canine-like species with porcupine quills. Despite appearances otherwise, Wildmut's greatest strength was his enhanced senses.

name: Ripjaws
summary: Ripjaws was an aquatic alien, with a design resembling a humanoid angler fish. When in water, his legs would shift into a mermaid-like tail. Ripjaws had one of the most fearsome alien designs in the series, but his abilities came with major drawbacks.
info: Ripjaws Had The Most Limited Utility.
